scheme_data.schemeName: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department: Stationary-Text Books
scheme_data.shortDescription: {"id": "hBScPpIBL4KEf1-W8hqr", "fields": {"beneficiaryState": ["Tamil Nadu"], "schemeShortTitle": "ADTWSTB", "level": "State", "nodalMinistryName": null, "schemeCategory": ["Education & Learning"], "schemeName": "Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department: Stationary-Text Books", "schemeCloseDate": null, "slug": "adtwstb", "briefDescription": "This scheme provides free textbooks to students from 1st to 12th standard in Adi Dravidar and Tribal welfare schools.\n", "age": {"st": {"gte": 6, "lte": 18}}, "tags": ["Tribal Welfare", "Adi Dravidar", "Text Books", "Education"]}, "highlight": {}}
scheme_data.description:
The name of this welfare scheme is Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department: Stationary-Text Books. It is also known as ADTWSTB. The scheme “Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department: Stationary-Text Books” by the Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu, is designed to support students from 1st to 12th standard who are enrolled in Adi Dravidar and Tribal welfare schools by offering them free textbooks. This initiative aims to ensure that no student is deprived of education due to a lack of study materials. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Tamil Nadu. Additionally, the nodal department is Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department.

The scheme provides the following benefits: Textbooks: Free textbooks for students from 1st to 12th standard.
<br>

Eligibility criteria include: The beneficiary should be a Student.
  The beneficiary should be a resident of Tamil Nadu.
  The beneficiary should be enrolled in Adi Dravidar and Tribal welfare schools.
  The beneficiary must be studying in any class between 1st to 12th standard. The application process is as follows: Students/ Guardians should contact the Headmaster of the School with all the required documents as directed by the authority. For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://www.tn.gov.in/scheme/data_view/83086 Tags associated with the scheme include: Adi Dravidar, Education, Text Books, Tribal Welfare.

ctus.text: The name of this welfare scheme is Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department: Stationary-Text Books. It is also known as ADTWSTB. The scheme “Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department: Stationary-Text Books” by the Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu, is designed to support students from 1st to 12th standard who are enrolled in Adi Dravidar and Tribal welfare schools by offering them free textbooks. This initiative aims to ensure that no student is deprived of education due to a lack of study materials.

The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Tamil Nadu. Additionally, the nodal department is Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department. The scheme provides the following benefits: Textbooks: Free textbooks for students from 1st to 12th standard.

<br> Eligibility criteria include: The beneficiary should be a Student. The beneficiary should be a resident of Tamil Nadu. The beneficiary should be enrolled in Adi Dravidar and Tribal welfare schools. The beneficiary must be studying in any class between 1st to 12th standard.

The application process is as follows: Students/ Guardians should contact the Headmaster of the School with all the required documents as directed by the authority. For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://www. tn. gov.
